articles.description: Sjoeke Nusken's double helps Chelsea earn a comfortable win at Ajax and take control of their Women's Champions League quarter-final.
articles.title: Nusken goals put Chelsea in control of quarter-final

articles.description: Aryna Sabalenka intends to play in the Miami Open following the death of her boyfriend, former ice hockey player Konstantin Koltsov.
articles.title: Konstantin Koltsov: Aryna Sabalenka to play in Miami Open after death of boyfriend

articles.description: After his first England senior call-up, BBC Sport charts the rise of Manchester United youngster Kobbie Mainoo.
articles.title: 'He gives me Seedorf vibes' - the rise of England new kid Mainoo

articles.description: Real Madrid file a complaint against the referee who took charge of Saturday's game at Osasuna for not including allegations of racist abuse of Vinicius Jr in his match report.
articles.title: Real complain as referee omits abuse of Vinicius Jr

articles.description: The International Olympic Committee condemns "a cynical attempt" by Russia "to politicise sport" through its plans to host a 'Friendship Games'.
articles.title: Russia's planned 'Friendship Games' a 'cynical attempt' to 'politicise sport', says IOC

articles.description: England centre Manu Tuilagi will leave Sale Sharks at the end of the season to join French club Bayonne.
articles.title: England centre Tuilagi to leave Sale for Bayonne

articles.description: BBC Sport Wales profiles Ben Davies, a Wales and Tottenham stalwart but one who prefers to shun the limelight.
articles.title: Ben Davies: Wales and Tottenham's reluctant star

articles.description: Referees' chief Howard Webb says VAR was right not to interfere in Liverpool being denied a late penalty against Manchester City.
articles.title: 'VAR right to stay out of Liverpool-Man City decision'

articles.description: Eight-time winners Lyon come from behind to defeat Benfica and put themselves in a strong position to progress to the semi-finals of the Women's Champions League.
articles.title: Lyon hit back to beat Benfica in Champions League

articles.description: Athletes' lives could be at risk if the Enhanced Games are allowed to go ahead, says Australian Sports Commission boss Kieren Perkins.
articles.title: 'Athletes' lives at risk at Enhanced Games'
